verses.kjv: My son, attend unto my wisdom, and bow thine ear to my understanding:
verses.ct: My son, pay close attention to my wisdom, and listen carefully to my understanding.

verses.kjv: That thou mayest regard discretion, and that thy lips may keep knowledge.
verses.ct: This way you'll hold on to good judgment, and your words will reflect knowledge.

verses.kjv: For the lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb, and her mouth is smoother than oil:
verses.ct: The lips of an immoral woman are as sweet as honey, and her speech is smoother than oil.

verses.kjv: But her end is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a two-edged sword.
verses.ct: But in the end she is as bitter as poison and as dangerous as a double-edged sword.

verses.kjv: Her feet go down to death; her steps take hold on hell.
verses.ct: Her path leads straight down to death; her steps head directly toward the grave.

verses.kjv: Lest thou shouldest ponder the path of life, her ways are moveable, that thou canst not know them.
verses.ct: She never considers the road that leads to life. Her paths wander all over, and she doesn't even realize it.

verses.kjv: Hear me now therefore, O ye children, and depart not from the words of my mouth.
verses.ct: So listen to me now, my sons, and don't turn away from what I'm telling you.

verses.kjv: Remove thy way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her house:
verses.ct: Stay far away from her, and don't even go near the door of her house.

verses.kjv: Lest thou give thine honour unto others, and thy years unto the cruel:
verses.ct: Otherwise you'll hand your dignity over to others and give your best years to someone merciless.

verses.kjv: Lest strangers be filled with thy wealth; and thy labours be in the house of a stranger;
verses.ct: Strangers will consume your wealth, and everything you worked for will end up in someone else's household.

verses.kjv: And thou mourn at the last, when thy flesh and thy body are consumed,
verses.ct: Then at the end of your life you'll groan in regret, when your health and body are wasted away.

verses.kjv: And say, How have I hated instruction, and my heart despised reproof;
verses.ct: You'll say, 'Why did I reject discipline? Why did my heart push away correction?'

verses.kjv: And have not obeyed the voice of my teachers, nor inclined mine ear to them that instructed me!
verses.ct: 'I refused to listen to my teachers and ignored those who tried to instruct me!'

verses.kjv: I was almost in all evil in the midst of the congregation and assembly.
verses.ct: 'I nearly ruined myself completely, right there in front of the whole community.'

verses.kjv: Drink waters out of thine own cistern, and running waters out of thine own well.
verses.ct: Drink water from your own cistern — fresh, flowing water from your own well.

verses.kjv: Let thy fountains be dispersed abroad, and rivers of waters in the streets.
verses.ct: Should your springs overflow into the streets, your streams of water into the public squares?

verses.kjv: Let them be only thine own, and not strangers’ with thee.
verses.ct: They should be yours alone, not shared with strangers.

verses.kjv: Let thy fountain be blessed: and rejoice with the wife of thy youth.
verses.ct: May your own spring be blessed, and find your joy in the wife you married when you were young.

verses.kjv: Let her be as the loving hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts satisfy thee at all times; and be thou ravished always with her love.
verses.ct: She is as graceful as a deer, as lovely as a gazelle. Let her body always satisfy you; let her love constantly captivate you.

verses.kjv: And why wilt thou, my son, be ravished with a strange woman, and embrace the bosom of a stranger?
verses.ct: My son, why would you let yourself be captivated by an immoral woman? Why would you hold another woman close?

verses.kjv: For the ways of man are before the eyes of the LORD, and he pondereth all his goings.
verses.ct: The LORD sees everything a person does; he examines every path they take.

verses.kjv: His own iniquities shall take the wicked himself, and he shall be holden with the cords of his sins.
verses.ct: A wicked person's own sins will trap him; he'll be caught and held tight by the ropes of his wrongdoing.

verses.kjv: He shall die without instruction; and in the greatness of his folly he shall go astray.
verses.ct: He will die for lack of discipline, led astray by the sheer magnitude of his foolishness.
